cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT- Printed for the War Cabinet. "December, 1944:SECRET; '- ' - Copy No; Q2W.M. (44) ;- ,162nd Conclusions.$ WAR CABINET 162 (44).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet, held at 10 Downing Street,S.W. I, on Thursday, 7th December, 1944, at 7 p.m.Present:The Right Hon. Winston S. Churchill, M.P., Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. .C. R. Attlee, . M.P.,Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. Sir John Anderson,M.P., Chancellor of the Exchequer.The Right Hon. Oliver Lyttelton,M.P., Minister of Production.The Right Hon. Anthony Eden, M.P.,Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M.P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService. .The Right Hon. Herbert Morrison,M.P., Secretary of State for theHome Department and Minister ofHome Security.The Right Hon. Lord WooltonjMinister of Reconstruction.The following were also present:The Right Hon. Viscount Cranborne,Secretary of State for DominionAffairs.The Right Hon. James Stuart, M.P.,Joint Parliamentary Secretary,Treasury.The Right Hon. Sir archibald sinclair, Bt., M.P., Secretary ofState for Air.The Right Hon. W. Whiteley, M.P.,Joint Parliamentary Secretary,Treasury.Secretariat:Sir Edward Bridges. .General Sir Hastings L. Ismay.Sir Gilbert Laithwaite.[28871-1] Foreign Affairs. The War Cabinet were informed that arrangements.had beenGreece made for a debate to take place on the following day4 on the followingand Italy. Amendment to the Address : (Previous , ; " But humbly regret that the Gracious Speech containsReferences: no assurance that His MajestyV forces will not be" used toWiM. (44) 103rd disarm the friends of democracy in Greece and other parts pfConclusions, Europe, or to suppress those popular movements wjiieh-haveMinute l; and valorously assisted in the defeat of the enemy and upon whosew;m. (44) 126th success we must rely for future friendly co-operation in conclusions, Europe." ' ' haWjMinute 7.) Tke War Cabinet had a discussion as to the points likely to arise in the debate and the line to be taken by the Prime Minister.A record of the discussion is contained in the Secretary'standard File of War Cabinet Conclusions.Offices of the War Cabinet, S.W. 1,7th December, 1944.
